hanzi-su-wiki:
録

Значения

Запись, регистрация

Мнемоника

Справа — свежеобструганное дерево. Вверху — рука 彐, горизонталь показывает, что верхушка срезана. Ниже — стружки. Делать металлом 金 зарубки на дощечках, писать.

Варианты

錄, 录
purpleculture_pinyin:
lù
Japanese variant of 录
Японский вариант 录
rtega_mnemonic:
録録RSrecord, copy
  • write down 录 in metal 金: a record for eternity
purpleculture_info: Ideographic: To carve 釒 a record 录; 录 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 釒 [ jīn ] gold, metal; money
    • 录 [ lù ] to copy, to record, to write down
heisig_constituent: record, metal, gold, dustpan, broom, grains of rice
heisig_story: Metal . . . broom . . . rice. Note how the final stroke of the broom is extended slightly when an element below is attached directly to it.
koohiiStory1: A monk won a gold metal for breaking the current record for most swept rice in one minute.
koohiiStory2: This character is about a recording for a music box. The tines of the mechanism are like a metal broom and the little pins on the cylinder are like metal grains of rice.
jp_example_words:
登録(とうろく): registration, register, entry, record
付録(ふろく): appendix, supplement
目録(もくろく): catalogue, catalog, list
記録(きろく): record, minutes, document
録音(ろくおん): (audio) recording
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A gold Wolverine swam in the water while his father made a record of it. Wolverine is gold in color because he just won the gold medal in swimming, so now he is gold. Way to go, Wolverine.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: See this gold Wolverine holding his gold medal after getting out of the water. His dad doesn’t want to forget anything about this precious moment so he makes a record of it. Imagine him scribbling furiously in his notebook.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Since Wolverine is actually a mutant, he is soon disqualified from his gold medal. His father makes a record of this also. One angry fan threw a rock (ろく) at Wolverine afterwards. Then another threw a rock. And another rock. Before you knew it, everyone was throwing rocks at Wolverine. Wolverine’s dad didn’t step in to help though, he just kept keeping records.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine a pitiful Wolverine crying on the ground as each rock hits him. All he wanted was some recognition from his father. Poor guy. Imagine poor Wolverine like this as his dad just looks on and writes in his notebook.
Ru_Notes: Сравни: 緑 (みどり、リョク、ロク зелёный)
Ru_Radicals: ヨ, 水 (вода), 金 (золото), 隶 (раб)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the gold (金) gives a watery yo (录) when it records

録字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lù］
［《廣韻》力玉切，入燭，來。］
“录2”的繁体字。亦作“錄1”。
(1)记录；记载。
(2)登记以便存查。
(3)簿籍，册籍。
(4)文体名。古代一种应用文。
(5)文体名。史籍志书类。
(6)文体名。目录。
(7)文体名。记事文。
(8)抄写；誊录。
(9)收藏；收集。
(10)采取，采用。
(11)指录用，任用。
(12)收留；收容。
(13)拘捕。
(14)指查抄。
(15)检束。
(16)统领；管领。
(17)次第。
(18)谈说。
(19)通“禄”。
(20)通“碌”。
(21)通“籙”。参见“録紀”。
(22)通“緑”。青黄色。参见“録蘭”。
(23)通“緑”。利剑名。
[②]［lǜ］
［《集韻》良據切，去御，來。］
“录3”的繁体字。亦作“錄2”。
省察；甄别。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［lù］
["Guangyun" Liyu cut, enter the candle, come. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "录2". Also called "Record 1".
(1) Record; record.
(2) Register for storage and inspection.
(3) Books and books.
(4) The name of the style. An ancient practical writing.
(5) The name of the style. Historical records and chronicles.
(6) The name of the style. table of Contents.
(7) The name of the style. Notes.
(8) Copy; Transcript.
(9) Collection; collection.
(10) Take, adopt.
(11) Refers to employment and appointment.
(12) Take in; take in.
(13) Arrest.
(14) Refers to checking.
(15) Inspection beam.
(16) Command; control.
(17) The order.
(18) Talk about it.
(19) Through "Lu".
(20) Through "Lu".
(21) Links to "箓". See "Record Record".
(22) Pass "green". Cyan. See "Lan Lan".
(23) Pass "green". The name of the sword.
[②] [lǜ]
["Jiyun" good according to cut, go to imperial, come. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "录3". Also as "Record 2".
Inspection; screening.

Name meaning

lù
яп. вм. 录
Radicals: 金, ヨ, 水  (gold, wolverine, water)
Meaning Mnemonic
A gold Wolverine swam in the water while his father made a record of it. Wolverine is gold in color because he just won the gold medal in swimming, so now he is gold. Way to go, Wolverine.
See this gold Wolverine holding his gold medal after getting out of the water. His dad doesn’t want to forget anything about this precious moment so he makes a record of it. Imagine him scribbling furiously in his notebook.
Reading Mnemonic
Since Wolverine is actually a mutant, he is soon disqualified from his gold medal. His father makes a record of this also. One angry fan threw a rock (ろく) at Wolverine afterwards. Then another threw a rock. And another rock. Before you knew it, everyone was throwing rocks at Wolverine. Wolverine’s dad didn’t step in to help though, he just kept keeping records.
Imagine a pitiful Wolverine crying on the ground as each rock hits him. All he wanted was some recognition from his father. Poor guy. Imagine poor Wolverine like this as his dad just looks on and writes in his notebook.
